comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Margaret Harwood's papers are at the Schlesinger Library on the History of Women in America at Harvard: oasis.lib.harvard.edu/oasis/deliver/~sch00771 During WWII, she taught navigation to Navy Sea Bees in Nantucket.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Just noticed that Margaret Harwood doesn't have a wikipedia entry yet.  Leaving this note so I'll remember to do something about that when I get a chance, unless someone else gets to it first.

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: Hi Penny, Thank you for letting us know about the purse and thank you in advance for letting us know about adding Margaret Harwood to Wikipedia. FYI, we will be participating in an upcoming "Wikipedia Loves Libraries" edit-a-thon on October 12. Although you sadly are far away, you could participate remotely if you're interested. More details are here: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Meetup/DC/WLL/2012 Sincerely, Effie

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: I just added her name under "Articles to Start" at the meetup page, so if I don't get to it before the edit-a-thon, someone there might give it a go.
